instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1502: What is A1502? A1502 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2014, Late 2013, Early 2015 with EMC 2875, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-3476, 820-3536, 820-4924..
definitions.A1278: What is A1278? A1278 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook or Macbook Pro Unibody from years Late 2008, Mid 2009, Mid 2010, Early 2011, Late 2011, Mid 2012 with EMC 2254, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2327, 820-2530, 820-2879, 820-2936, 820-3115..

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2014
threads.message: It is possible to replace only the keyboard in <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2014? Or need to replace something more?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2014
threads.message:
go to ebay
type the model number folled by what you want
<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> keyboard
[url]http://www.ebay.com.au/itm/Apple-MacBook-Pro-13-<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>-US-Keyboard-Retina-ME864-ME865-ME866-2013-/162243482079?hash=item25c67711df:g:dacAAOSw8w1YBXD7[/url]
if you see hundreds of results its possible if you see none then its probably impossible or rather difficult
a good example is macbook air lcd, finding the entire display assembly is easy, finding the lcd only is a bit harder

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2014
threads.message: Rip the old one out, whack out the remaining rivets with a screw driver/hammer and mount the new keyboard with screws salvaged from an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>/1286 keyboard. You also need to lift the middle battery cell and remove the trackpad cover.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2014
threads.message: oh yeah i forgot to mention you have to use force to pull the old one out, an unreasonable amount of force

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2014
threads.message: my receptionist uses an xcelite 175m to remove each rivet. it's a pain in the ass, but totally doable. Practice on a top case that is too fucked up to reuse. If you don't get the rivet out on the first go, it's stuck in there forever, and you have 1 less screwhole to use.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2014
threads.message:
What about keyboard A1342? I have to replace now. 
It is possible to replace too?
